column4: I'm basically looking for a good backup method and I thought RAID was the answer... now I'm having my doubts.
for just data / files scp works well and pretty secure
well if your power supply decides to go insane and breaks your drives you would have a problem (it doesnt happen much but you never know)
that's a good point...
you could take the drive out and only put it in to backup stuff
but i wouldnt recommend that either to be honest
I know that is probably a better idea but I know I will get lazy and want a "set it and forget it" option, lol
there are these cheap ass sleds for drives, exist for both IDE and SATA :)
those are pretty conveniant
hmmm, may be worth looking into
or get a good case which allows you to slide the drives out :p
the server is ok, but you sohuld have a backup aswell imo
preferably a different machine or even different location
I agree. I just don't have another machine that is always going, which is part of my problem
